00023   struct RecList
00024   {
00025     virtual ~RecList() {}
00026 
00027     virtual void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id) = 0;
00028     virtual int getSize() = 0;
00029     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const = 0;

00031     static std::string toLower (const std::string& name)
00032     {
00033         std::string lowerCase;
00034 
00035         std::transform (name.begin(), name.end(), std::back_inserter (lowerCase),
00036             (int(*)(int)) std::tolower);
00037 
00038         return lowerCase;
00039     }
00040   };

00044   template <typename X>
00045   struct RecListT : RecList
00046   {
00047     virtual ~RecListT() {}
00048 
00049     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00050 
00051     MapType list;
00052 
00053     // Load one object of this type
00054     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00055     {
00056       std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00057       list[id2].load(esm);
00058     }
00059 
00060     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00061     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00062     {
00063         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00064 
00065         typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id2);
00066 
00067         if (iter == list.end())
00068             return NULL;
00069 
00070         return &iter->second;
00071     }
00072 
00073     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00074     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00075     {
00076         const X *object = search (id);
00077 
00078         if (!object)
00079             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00080 
00081         return object;
00082     }
00083 
00084     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00085 
00086     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00087     {
00088         for (typename MapType::const_iterator iter (list.begin()); iter!=list.end(); ++iter)
00089             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00090     }
00091   };

00267   struct LTexList : RecList
00268   {
00269     virtual ~LTexList() {}
00270 
00271     // TODO: For multiple ESM/ESP files we need one list per file.
00272     std::vector<LandTexture> ltex;
00273 
00274     LTexList()
00275     {
00276       // More than enough to hold Morrowind.esm.
00277       ltex.reserve(128);
00278     }
00279 
00280     const LandTexture* search(size_t index) const
00281     {
00282         assert(index < ltex.size());
00283         return &ltex.at(index);
00284     }
00285 
00286     int getSize() { return ltex.size(); }
00287     int getSize() const { return ltex.size(); }
00288 
00289     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00290 
00291     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00292     {
00293       LandTexture lt;
00294       lt.load(esm);
00295       lt.id = id;
00296 
00297       // Make sure we have room for the structure
00298       if(lt.index + 1 > (int)ltex.size())
00299         ltex.resize(lt.index+1);
00300 
00301       // Store it
00302       ltex[lt.index] = lt;
00303     }
00304   };

00306   /* Landscapes are indexed by the X,Y coordinates of the exterior
00307      cell they belong to.

00309   struct LandList : RecList
00310   {
00311     virtual ~LandList()
00312     {
00313       for ( LandMap::iterator itr = lands.begin(); itr != lands.end(); ++itr )
00314       {
00315           delete itr->second;
00316       }
00317     }
00318 
00319     // Map containing all landscapes
00320     typedef std::pair<int, int> LandCoord;
00321     typedef std::map<LandCoord, Land*> LandMap;
00322     LandMap lands;
00323 
00324     int count;
00325     LandList() : count(0) {}
00326     int getSize() { return count; }
00327 
00328     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00329 
00330     // Find land for the given coordinates. Return null if no data.
00331     Land *search(int x, int y) const
00332     {
00333       LandMap::const_iterator itr = lands.find(std::make_pair<int, int>(x, y));
00334       if ( itr == lands.end() )
00335       {
00336         return NULL;
00337       }
00338 
00339       return itr->second;
00340     }
00341 
00342     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00343     {
00344       count++;
00345 
00346       // Create the structure and load it. This actually skips the
00347       // landscape data and remembers the file position for later.
00348       Land *land = new Land();
00349       land->load(esm);
00350 
00351       // Store the structure
00352       lands[std::make_pair<int, int>(land->X, land->Y)] = land;
00353     }
00354   };

00356     struct ciLessBoost : std::binary_function<std::string, std::string, bool>
00357 {
00358     bool operator() (const std::string & s1, const std::string & s2) const {
00359                                                //case insensitive version of is_less
00360         return lexicographical_compare(s1, s2, is_iless());
00361     }
00362 };

00365   // Cells aren't simply indexed by name. Exterior cells are treated
00366   // separately.
00367   // TODO: case handling (cell names are case-insensitive, but they are also showen to the
00368   // player, so we can't simply smash case.
00369   struct CellList : RecList
00370   {
00371     // Total cell count. Used for statistics.
00372     int count;
00373     CellList() : count(0) {}
00374     int getSize() { return count; }
00375 
00376     // List of interior cells. Indexed by cell name.
00377     typedef std::map<std::string,ESM::Cell*, ciLessBoost> IntCells;
00378     IntCells intCells;
00379 
00380     // List of exterior cells. Indexed as extCells[gridX][gridY].
00381     typedef std::map<std::pair<int, int>, ESM::Cell*> ExtCells;
00382     ExtCells extCells;
00383 
00384     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00385     {
00386         for (IntCells::const_iterator iter (intCells.begin()); iter!=intCells.end(); ++iter)
00387             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00388     }
00389 
00390     virtual ~CellList()
00391     {
00392       for (IntCells::iterator it = intCells.begin(); it!=intCells.end(); ++it)
00393         delete it->second;
00394 
00395       for (ExtCells::iterator it = extCells.begin(); it!=extCells.end(); ++it)
00396           delete it->second;
00397     }
00398 
00399     const ESM::Cell* searchInt(const std::string &id) const
00400     {
00401       IntCells::const_iterator iter = intCells.find(id);
00402 
00403       if (iter!=intCells.end())
00404         return iter->second;
00405 
00406       return 0;
00407     }
00408 
00409     const ESM::Cell* findInt(const std::string &id) const
00410     {
00411       const ESM::Cell *cell = searchInt (id);
00412 
00413       if (!cell)
00414          throw std::runtime_error ("Interior cell not found - " + id);
00415 
00416       return cell;
00417     }
00418 
00419     const ESM::Cell *searchExt (int x, int y) const
00420     {
00421         ExtCells::const_iterator it = extCells.find (std::make_pair (x, y));
00422 
00423         if (it==extCells.end())
00424             return 0;
00425 
00426         return it->second;
00427     }
00428 
00429     const ESM::Cell *findExt (int x, int y) const
00430     {
00431         const ESM::Cell *cell = searchExt (x, y);
00432 
00433         if (!cell)
00434             throw std::runtime_error ("Exterior cell not found");
00435 
00436         return cell;
00437     }
00438     const ESM::Cell *searchExtByName (const std::string& id) const
00439     {
00440         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00441         {
00442             if (toLower (iter->second->name) == toLower (id))
00443                 return iter->second;
00444         }
00445 
00446         return 0;
00447     }
00448 
00449     const ESM::Cell *searchExtByRegion (const std::string& id) const
00450     {
00451         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00452 
00453         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00454             if (toLower (iter->second->region)==id)
00455                 return iter->second;
00456 
00457         return 0;
00458     }
00459 
00460     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00461     {
00462       count++;
00463 
00464       // All cells have a name record, even nameless exterior cells.
00465       ESM::Cell *cell = new ESM::Cell;
00466       cell->name = id;
00467 
00468       // The cell itself takes care of all the hairy details
00469       cell->load(esm);
00470 
00471       if(cell->data.flags & ESM::Cell::Interior)
00472         {
00473           // Store interior cell by name
00474           intCells[id] = cell;
00475         }
00476       else
00477         {
00478           // Store exterior cells by grid position
00479           extCells[std::make_pair (cell->data.gridX, cell->data.gridY)] = cell;
00480         }
00481     }
00482   };

00484   struct PathgridList : RecList
00485   {
00486       int count;
00487 
00488       // List of grids for interior cells. Indexed by cell name.
00489       typedef std::map<std::string,ESM::Pathgrid*, ciLessBoost> IntGrids;
00490       IntGrids intGrids;
00491 
00492       // List of grids for exterior cells. Indexed as extCells[gridX][gridY].
00493       typedef std::map<std::pair<int, int>, ESM::Pathgrid*> ExtGrids;
00494       ExtGrids extGrids;
00495 
00496       PathgridList() : count(0) {}
00497 
00498       virtual ~PathgridList()
00499       {
00500           for (IntGrids::iterator it = intGrids.begin(); it!=intGrids.end(); ++it)
00501               delete it->second;
00502 
00503           for (ExtGrids::iterator it = extGrids.begin(); it!=extGrids.end(); ++it)
00504               delete it->second;
00505       }
00506 
00507       int getSize() { return count; }
00508 
00509       virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00510       {
00511           // do nothing
00512       }
00513 
00514       void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00515       {
00516           count++;
00517           ESM::Pathgrid *grid = new ESM::Pathgrid;
00518           grid->load(esm);
00519           if (grid->data.x == 0 && grid->data.y == 0)
00520           {
00521               intGrids[grid->cell] = grid;
00522           }
00523           else
00524           {
00525               extGrids[std::make_pair(grid->data.x, grid->data.y)] = grid;
00526           }
00527       }
00528 
00529       Pathgrid *find(int cellX, int cellY, const std::string &cellName) const
00530       {
00531           Pathgrid *result = search(cellX, cellY, cellName);
00532           if (!result)
00533           {
00534               throw std::runtime_error("no pathgrid found for cell " + cellName);
00535           }
00536           return result;
00537       }
00538 
00539       Pathgrid *search(int cellX, int cellY, const std::string &cellName) const
00540       {
00541           Pathgrid *result = NULL;
00542           if (cellX == 0 && cellY == 0) // possibly interior
00543           {
00544               IntGrids::const_iterator it = intGrids.find(cellName);
00545               if (it != intGrids.end())
00546                 result = it->second;
00547           }
00548           else
00549           {
00550               ExtGrids::const_iterator it = extGrids.find(std::make_pair(cellX, cellY));
00551               if (it != extGrids.end())
00552                 result = it->second;
00553           }
00554           return result;
00555       }
00556 
00557       Pathgrid *search(const ESM::Cell &cell) const
00558       {
00559           int cellX, cellY;
00560           if (cell.data.flags & ESM::Cell::Interior)
00561           {
00562               cellX = cellY = 0;
00563           }
00564           else
00565           {
00566               cellX = cell.data.gridX;
00567               cellY = cell.data.gridY;
00568           }
00569           return search(cellX, cellY, cell.name);
00570       }
00571   };

00573   template <typename X>
00574   struct ScriptListT : RecList
00575   {
00576     virtual ~ScriptListT() {}
00577 
00578     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00579 
00580     MapType list;
00581 
00582     // Load one object of this type
00583     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00584     {
00585       X ref;
00586       ref.load (esm);
00587 
00588       std::string realId = toLower (ref.data.name.toString());
00589 
00590       std::swap (list[realId], ref);
00591     }
00592 
00593     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00594     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00595     {
00596         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00597 
00598         typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id2);
00599 
00600         if (iter == list.end())
00601             return NULL;
00602 
00603         return &iter->second;
00604     }
00605 
00606     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00607     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00608     {
00609         const X *object = search (id);
00610 
00611         if (!object)
00612             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00613 
00614         return object;
00615     }
00616 
00617     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00618 
00619     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00620     {
00621         for (typename MapType::const_iterator iter (list.begin()); iter!=list.end(); ++iter)
00622             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00623     }
00624   };

00626   template <typename X>
00627   struct IndexListT
00628   {
00629         virtual ~IndexListT() {}
00630 
00631         typedef std::map<int, X> MapType;
00632 
00633         MapType list;
00634 
00635         void load(ESMReader &esm)
00636         {
00637             X ref;
00638             ref.load (esm);
00639             int index = ref.index;
00640             list[index] = ref;
00641         }
00642 
00643         int getSize()
00644         {
00645             return list.size();
00646         }
00647 
00648         virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00649 
00650         // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00651         const X* search (int id) const
00652         {
00653             typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id);
00654 
00655             if (iter == list.end())
00656                 return NULL;
00657 
00658             return &iter->second;
00659         }
00660 
00661         // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00662         const X* find (int id) const
00663         {
00664             const X *object = search (id);
00665 
00666             if (!object)
00667             {
00668                 std::ostringstream error;
00669                 error << "object " << id << " not found";
00670                 throw std::runtime_error (error.str());
00671             }
00672 
00673             return object;
00674         }
00675   };
